name: anathan
text: A comment left by anathan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, Taidje_Khan, VictoriaW)

name: gouldgonewild
text: A comment left by gouldgonewild was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by kenthegod, Sweetlips, Taidje_Khan)

name: fmercury
text: Bloomington is like an oasis in a sea of misery that is Indiana. Just go ten miles south, you'll see some shrinking heads.

name: autrepoupee
text:
I just wish Southern Indiana would secede or something. Us Northern Indy types are pretty alright, really.

R-O-C-K IN THE U-S-A!

name: pogo
text: In Wisconsin, it's reversed.  All the dullards like Up North.

name: tangles
text: hey, damnit! i live in teh northwoods and... yeah, it's true. i can't wait to gtfo

name: tangles
text: hey, damnit! i live in teh northwoods and... yeah, it's true. i can't wait to gtfo

name: fineoakstructure
text: so, basically, the closer you get to Chicago, the better?

name: carlyle
text: Fuck yeah

name: miku224
text: You can enjoy Up North without being a dullard, though.  I certainly hope so, anyway.

name: atlanticcity
text: Get The Region out of Indiana!  Aww hell ya.  Unless you're from North East Indiana.  In which case...you're still alright.

name: ajesteronly
text:
Hey now.

I live in a comparatively southern part of that fine state (Or used to, at least.) We think that the northern part of the state is boring.

The land, she lacks the curves and mounds of a beautiful woman like we have in the south. That kind of landscape makes you fall in love with a place, I think.

name: gazdatronik
text: Yeah, I am from northern Indiana and that is true. How have I never made this observation?

name: syrupykeyboard
text: What's up, fellow B-tonian?

name: gouldgonewild
text: It's a little late, but not much.

name: deimosrising
text: A comment left by deimosrising was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Taidje_Khan, VictoriaW, dj)

name: idsyen
text: Rural Southwest PA too. The theoretical borderline makes little difference in cultural terms. Ah, for the small times in the sticks. They weren't so bad really. OK, maybe they were, but at least I'm not a serial killer.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Oh man, southwestern Pennsylvania.  All you need to see is Peachins in Dunbar, PA.  At least, the old Peachins.

name: catachresis
text: Nice Pete's dad either has a really deep, slow voice like Lennie from Of Mice and Men, or a really hilarious high voice. I can't decide. Both are good.

name: agika
text: The high pitched voice would make sense to me.  It would also be quiet, tiny like the head that uses it.

name: luckypyjamas
text: i think it starts out slow and deep and gets gradually higher and faster as his head shrinks

name: spinynorman
text: I like how mom-mom "had" to die. The implication that death happens regardless of intent or even causality adds a lot to Nice Pete.

name: i_love_kate
text: He got there the same way that the coin did.

name: daklin
text: Definitely the slow and deep voice

name: smilebuddha
text: My vote for the sound of Nice Pete's voice is that of Shelby Foote, best known for his appearances from Ken Burns' The Civil War . Stately, courtly, with an air of a deep, distant knowledge of empires, and populations, and time.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Yes, Mr. Foote is a Suth'n Genn'lman...and don't forget the vocal resignation that he is soon to become a statistic, and that his son will thereafter wreak something Not Nice on the world that is not round parts of West Virginia.

name: chaesar
text: Love how panel 5 and panel 6 are basically two parts of one image.

name: connellingus
text: I like that device in comics when it's used to convey motion across a scene, but in this case I think the image would just work better as one panel.

name: shutup_shutup
text: I disagree. In 5 you are focusing on Nice Pete talking.  In 6 you are focusing on Teodor listening.  It gives it an almost cinematic effect.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Nice Pete grew up in a place where the people make a living from the land, live on the land, and when they die they become one with it.

name: nathanielperson
text: Also, the land has ground chemicals in it.

name: flynn
text: If Nice Pete made a movie, that movie would be Gummo.

name: deancain29
text: the last panel.... so...funny

name: tomsmith
text: A comment left by tomsmith was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, SpinyNorman, Taidje_Khan)

name: deancain29
text: you're right - I'm sorry. I had a friend like that once.

name: philosophe
text: She had to die.

name: peterjoel
text: The doctors had to send her to be killed.

name: molesticide
text:
yeah, i also read "HAD to die because of..." as meaning that they had to put her down like a sick old dog.

also, i'm a big fan of that second panel, which in mind is nice pete having a little nostalgia moment of his own, remembering maybe some bad times, or some good, taking a deep breath and letting out half a sigh before he responds.

name: bartleby
text: I sort of read it as Pete just parroting back what he was told as a youth, when he asked why Mom-Mom was dead. The ground chemicals. They are part of life. There is no escaping the ground chemicals.

name: paperboy_2000
text:
In the 2nd panel I see Nice Pete going through his own flow chart.
Is this a gentlemanly question?
Might he be implying that I am of low mind?
How much bleach do I have in the van?
Téodor is fortunate that Pete ends up in the [reminiscences] box and not the [murder] box; 'tis not much distance 'tween the two.

name: spinynorman
text: There is great irony in saying that I would kill to see a Nice Pete decision making flow chart.

name: overmedicated
text: ...uh oh.

name: spinynorman
text:
Yeah, I don't recall if that comment came before or after one was actually made.

Probably after. :(

name: envika
text: Well before.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: They have a Venn overlap. A large one, surely.

name: jesler729
text: This one is really great.

name: tekende
text: It's strips like this where I can't help but hear Nice Pete sounding like that character from Family Guy who shows up every now and then and has that weird gay voice. "Oh, no one had any of the Oreos! It's okay, I'll take the rest home to the cats."

name: stockcar
text: It's always West Virginia.

name: tekende
text: It's never lupus.

name: wulvaine
text:
The creepy thing about this for me is that, knowing Nice Pete, my mind makes me think that when he says his mother had to die because of the ground chemicals, he means that he killed her himself out of mercy as she got sicker and sicker.

That just casts a sinister light on this strip, even if that isn't what Onstad meant.

name: wulvaine
text:
Also, I don't know if I can really imagine Nice Pete saving a tadpole, even as a child.

Formally executing, perhaps. But rescue seems a bit of an incongruous behavior for a murderer.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Maybe he would take a picture of a tadpole. And put that picture on the Internet.

name: dorothypoopbot
text: This was probably before Mom-mom had to die and Daddy's head-shrinking disease began. It shows how his life changed him over the years. Also, taking a tadpole's life into his hands shows a certain preoccupation with life and death, and the control there is to be had over both.

name: asobi
text: Man, don't you get it?  He's got Southern ways.  That tadpole didn't anger him none.  It just swam around like a good old creature of God oughta.

name: jamsok
text: Nice Pete is a kind-natured Yankee good ol' boy.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
dear inspector doofie,

a virginian isnt a yankee.

name: sixkindsofnasty
text: But he mentions being from West Virginia...which actually split from Virginia because it agreed with the north. Just sayin'

name: greenkoolayd
text: have you ever been to that place?  if you have, you would know that it is opposite of everything a "yankee" stands for.  its like a big perry county(you would get that joke if you were from south central PA.....)

name: direhaggis
text: Nice Pete is a misunderstood, rather eloquent serial murderer.

name: nabeel84
text: West Virginia? Figures. Isn't everyone in the state first cousins?

name: charchar
text: My mom's from there. Mt. Nebo. I don't know about the whole state, but we were there for a family reunion and in Wal-Mart she was like " There's your cousin, and that's your second-great-uncle and your third-cousin-thrice-removed-by-marriage" and I'm llike "How do you know these people and that stuff?"

name: snowman
text: Ten percent is a lot for annual head reduction.

name: aliiis
text: The last panel is basically the best thing I have ever seen

name: the_clarkness
text: I love that Teodor's response to, "Here are some of their hands," is not shock or horror but, "So, where'd you grow up?"

name: wurlitzergirl
text: I grew up in Tacoma, Washington. I understand the whole ground chemical thing; I'm amazed I wasn't born with two heads.

name: howl
text: oh god that place smells so bad when you drive into it

name: mr_lostman28
text:
I find myself staring deeply into that second panel... Nice Pete staring back at me, never blinking, our minds racing. What the hell is his response going to be? Is he going to kill me? OH GOD!!!

... Oh West Virginia huh.... th...thats nice.

name: radarjammer
text: If you did not five this strip then you do not understand the tragic hilarity of middle-age-onset-skull-shrinkage-syndrome (MAOSSS)

name: evilbobikus
text: Having been from WV and knowing people that grew up to become Nice Pete's, this strip pretty much made me connect and understand his character perfectly.  On that note it's such a great example of Onstad's ability to make excellent character backgrounds.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
your errant apostrophe became comic fodder yesterday.

i don't know to either chubby or lame you for this.
i'd probably lame it, though.

name: featurelessvoid
text: That might not be an errant apostrophe.  "People that grew up to become Nice Pete's" could be an example of the proper, possessive use of the apostrophe.  After all that work to collect a body and load it into his van, Nice Pete wouldn't necessarily just throw the prize away.

name: evilbobikus
text: With that in mind, the statement is true both ways.

name: dj_douche
text: Pet's daddy's voice shrinks along with his head. Imagining a helium-balloon squeaky voice coming from that husky body with the shrunken head is so incongruous it is completely understated hilarity. It's implied humour like this that is the best of all humour IMO.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: no, i think it would be funnier that his voice got lower the smaller his head got, 'cos you'd expect the helium thing to happen, y'know?

name: machineelf
text: since when does nice pete know about things like percentages? (i think he is of low mind in regards to math)

name: vermy
text: This is before Teodor becomes an elitist bastard/Onstad uses Teodor as his rant voice/both-and

name: fattypneumonia
text:
T: So, where'd you bury the dismembered corpses?

(short pause)

NP: Oh, 'round parts of West Virginia

name: redmange
text: Parts of my Father's family hailed from West Virginia.  This is not far from the truth of life there, I will not attempt to make graces.

name: duperando
text: Oh my word panel five almost made me crap myself.

name: duperando
text: er, I meant the last panel. That shrunken head...

name: djorra
text: Don't worry, Daddy. According to the headcount report, you're only about 0.387% of a worker. You're safe for now.
